intro: Antoniana sylvestris, commonly known as the forest antoniana, is a flowering plant native to the dense, humid forests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in shaded environments and requires high humidity and well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
